intro: Wittmackia tentaculifera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
